thread.title: Bali Hosts Singing Champions from 13 Countries for KWC Asia Finals
thread.title_full: Bali Hosts Singing Champions from 13 Countries for KWC Asia Finals - PR.com

author: PR.com
title: Bali Hosts Singing Champions from 13 Countries for KWC Asia Finals
text:
Bali Hosts Singing Champions from 13 Countries for KWC Asia Finals
First ever KWC Asia Finals to be held 9-11 October 2015 in Boshe VVIP Club, Bali.
Bali, Indonesia, October 01, 2015 --( PR.com )-- KWC Asia Events Pte Ltd presents the first ever Karaoke World Championships (KWC) Asia Finals on 9-11 October 2015 to be held at Boshe VVIP Club, Bali, Indonesia.
“We are honoured to launch the KWC Asia Finals to feature the amazing singing talents in our region and also to build friendships among country champions who all share a love and passion for singing. The Asian finalists are well prepared for the upcoming competition in Bali. We are excited to welcome all participants and country organisers!” said Ms Hio Leng Lei, Director of KWC Asia Events Pte Ltd.
Karaoke World Championships (KWC) is an international brand originating from Finland and it is the biggest amateur singing competition in the world. National trials are conducted in each country with the winners competing in the International finals. This year, Singapore hosts the International Finals in conjunction with SG50 celebrating the nation’s 50th anniversary.
With strong partnerships among the participating 13 Asian countries – Singapore, Indonesia, Malaysia, Thailand, Vietnam, Myanmar, Philippines, Macau, Hong Kong, China, Taiwan, Japan and Korea - KWC Asia Events Pte Ltd is driving the launch of this regional singing competition where the first ever KWC Asia Male Champion and KWC Asia Female Champion titles will be awarded. Prizes for the winners include cash, trophies, recording contract and the chance to tour key cities in the region in roadshow concerts.
2014 KWC Singapore Champion, KWC World 2nd Runner-up & now recording-artist Sunny Jackson from Singapore as well as 2014 KWC Macau Champion & KWC World 4th Runner-up Kenny Chit will perform as guests in the Bali event.
The KWC Asia Finals is made possible with the support KWC Asia partners Draft Denmark, Inul Vizta, DigiMC and Japan’s largest karaoke manufacturer DAM. This is also supported by Indonesia’s Ministry of Tourism.
About the organisers:
Singapore-based KWC Asia Event Pte Ltd manages and organises the Asia competition of the Karaoke World Championships. KWC is the most prestigious Karaoke Singing event and largest amateur singing competition in the world. This multi cultural international music event fuses music, fun and friendship. Now on its 13th year, KWC transcends boundaries of race, nation and religion and provides amateur singers an opportunity to showcase their amazing talents to the world. It is a platform to foster camaraderie and goodwill among participating countries. For more details, visit www.kwc-asia.com.
